title: DOGCALL
descrption: DOGCALL is a backdoor used by APT37 that has been used to target South Korean government and military organizations in 2017. It is typically dropped using a Hangul Word Processor (HWP) exploit. [1]

references.title: FireEye. (2018, February 20). APT37 (Reaper): The Overlooked North Korean Actor. Retrieved March 1, 2018.
Grunzweig, J. (2018, October 01). NOKKI Almost Ties the Knot with DOGCALL: Reaper Group Uses New Malware to Deploy RAT. Retrieved November 5, 2018.

related.Name: Audio Capture
related.Use: DOGCALL can capture microphone data from the victim's machine.[2]

related.Name: Input Capture
related.Use: DOGCALL is capable of logging keystrokes.[1][2]

related.Name: Obfuscated Files or Information
related.Use: DOGCALL is encrypted using single-byte XOR.[2]

related.Name: Remote File Copy
related.Use: DOGCALL can download and execute additional payloads.[2]

related.Name: Screen Capture
related.Use: DOGCALL is capable of capturing screenshots of the victim's machine.[1][2]

related.Name: Web Service
related.Use: DOGCALL is capable of leveraging cloud storage APIs such as Cloud, Box, Dropbox, and Yandex for C2.[1][2]
